channel.title: Copyright on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Copyright on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: Is It Ever Legal—or Ethical—to Remove DRM?
item.description: Digital Rights Management software makes it difficult to copy movies, music, ebooks, and games that you already own. There are ways around it, but breaking DRM opens up legal and ethical concerns.

item.title: Is It Ever Legal—or Ethical—to Remove DRM?

item.title: OpenAI offers 20 million user chats in ChatGPT lawsuit. NYT wants 120 million.
item.description: OpenAI asks judge to drastically limit NYT access to ChatGPT logs.

item.title: News publishers take paywall-blocker 12ft.io offline
item.description: The News/Media Alliance, a trade association behind major news publishers, announced that it has “successfully secured” the removal of 12ft.io, a website that helped users bypass paywalls online. The

item.title: Watch Our Livestream Replay: Inside the AI Copyright Battles
item.description: Curious about generative AI and copyright? On July 16, our writers answered your questions about this critical topic.

item.title: YouTuber faces jail time for showing off Android-based gaming handhelds
item.description: Italian law allows for up to three years in jail for “promotion of pirated copyrighted materials.”

item.title: Join Our Livestream: Inside the AI Copyright Battles
